slide.title: Developer Relations – Overview
slide.p: All successful API platform have a mix of in-person and online activities to help promote the team’s API and support API consumers.

ul.li: Every API has a designated DevRel member
DevRel contact details are on the API landing page
DevRel assists in onboarding API consumers
DevRel handles API user support queries as needed

p.q: A mindset of getting developers to adopt a platform and making them successful with their initiatives.

span.a: What is Developer Relations and What are Common Roles?, Moesif

slide.title: Developer Relations – The Basics

ul.li: Responsible for outreach to target consumers
General API promotion (e.g. show features, possible uses)
Convert consumer feedback to producer action items

slide.p: DevRels are the "face" of the API

slide.title: Developer Relations – Additional Tasks

ul.li: Help API consumers solve problems w/ the API
Help API producers improve documentation and relate materials
Create and share training content (articles, videos, etc.)
Collaborate with other DevRels to improve the program

slide.p: DevRels are a bridge between producers and consumers

ul.li: Reduce time between reporting and resolving problems for API Consumers
Less need for one-on-one interactions, more reliance on peer-to-peer support
Shorter time between consumer feedback and product feature in production
Helping developers solve their problems with your API

Reduce time/cost needed to improve API consumer success

slide.title: API Onboarding : Basics

ul.li: API type [REST, GraphQL, etc.], use-case examples, limits [transactions, security, etc.]
Auth methods supported, token/expiration details, refresh methods, authorization details, etc.
Common workflow patterns, most common actions/methods, parameter bodies, etc.
Working small snippets through to fully-functional apps that use the API
HTTP methods, URLs, parameters/bodies, response bodies, headers, errors/status codes, etc.

slide.p: API Portals should be able to answer all your API consumer's initial questions

slide.title: API Onboarding : Advanced

ul.li: Comprehensive vocabulary document (names for data points and action elements)
Dedicated live chat and/or email forums for support (see above)

slide.p: NOTE: focus on the basics first. Once those are stable, move on to advanced items.
